description: What it doesn't tell you is you have to have a paid account with proton mail to use this bridge. So, minus one star for not giving all the information. Minus another star for the hassle.
Sometimes it looses connection on Mac. Don't know why. But they keep working on this software. So you will get a stream of updates.
Sure, it's a little bit of a hassle, but once you get it set up you don't ever have to think about it again.
summary: Does exactly what it says on the tin

description:
Steals focus in the middle of the workflow. As the app is updated every few days, this is quite the nuisance.
Could you please add an option "Do not warn about updates" somewhere ?
Thank you

I switched from Gmail to Protonmail but do worry about Proton's longevity. it's nice to have the Bridge and download the emails to Thunderbird.

However, the bridge is updated all the time, and the only way to set it working (that I have found) is download the new RPM, open up package manager, remove the old (whilst bridge is still running) and install the new. Then close the old and relaunch and voila, it's updated without loosing account settings. A faff but not the end of the world.
summary: Not bad - but updates are painful on Fedora

description: No issues with Thunderbird and what is mostly a Debian Buster stable installation.

A different review here mentions that they don't tell you you have to be a paid member for this so they must have changed that because now on the website for this they have it clearly stated so it wasn't an issue for me. The setup is super easy and they even have a video explaining how to setup the account through Thunderbird, which is great.
summary: Great product, makes protonmail in Thunderbird possible

description: I have a premium email account with protonmail and this is a really nice to have on linux if you care about having a local backup of your email. That is my primary reason for using the mail bridge.
Easy to install, works as it should
Fonctionne correctement mais par contre, 125Mo de RAM juste pour ça, c'est un peu abusé quand même...
Simple à utiliser et fonctionne nickel !
